pageContext.claim: “Take a look at some of the [small business] optimism charts and everything else. It went from 57 to 92. ”
pageContext.analysis: It’s not clear where Trump found these numbers. The standard measure of small business optimism is the NFIB’s small business optimism index. By that measure, small business optimism did hit a record high of 108.8 in August 2018, but has since declined below the level it was at when Trump took office.
